campaign.story:
Looking for your Coolest? Follow along with all our production news and updates at www.coolest.com/countdown!
A 21st Century Cooler? It's about time!
Regular coolers are boring, break easily and are a hassle to haul around just to carry the ice. The COOLEST cooler is 60 quarts of AWESOME packed with so much fun you'll look for excuses to get outside more often.
Maybe you want to use the built-in ice crushing blender to whip up some margaritas or smoothies on your next boat trip or tailgate?
Maybe you just want to always have music on hand with the waterproof bluetooth speaker or want to recharge your electronics with the built in USB charger?
What else?
REWARDS:
UPDATE:  Color Voting Complete! 
Here are the Final Coolest Color options. When you pledge for a Coolest we'll send you a survey after the campaign to make your color choice.
Scroll on down for more details...                     
      BLENDER
Nothing is more refreshing on a hot day than a cold blended cocktail or smoothie.  The 18 volt ice-crushing beast built into the COOLEST will power through more than 6 gallons of blended goodness on a single charge.
 WATERPROOF WIRELESS SPEAKERS
If life is supposed to be a party, then you better bring the music. You’re gathered around the cooler anyway, but now you can DJ the music right from your phone or Bluetooth-enabled device directly to your COOLEST. Just turn your phone on, match it with the COOLEST speaker, and rock out with your bad self.
                        USB CHARGER
 Since you’ve got that 18 volt battery for the blender, why not get the most out of it? Maybe your camera battery is low or maybe you have an iPhone you just want to use after 3:00 in the afternoon... Re-charge your gear wherever you are with the waterproof USB charger.
                          LED LID LIGHT
The party doesn’t stop just because the sun goes down, and you shouldn’t have to freeze your fingers searching endlessly for your favorite drink.  The COOLEST has unbreakable lights embedded in the lid so you easily find what you’re looking for with the push of a button.
                       GEAR TIE-DOWN
Carrying your gear to and from your destination is a hassle, and your old cooler isn’t doing you any favors.
The COOLEST's locking tie-downs are like having a roof-rack on your cooler so three trips can be done in one. Easily secure your lawn chairs, blankets, towels, toys, fishing tackle, or grill.
                         BEACH TIRES
One of the worst unintended workouts can be had by trying to drag a conventional cooler through a sandy beach.  The COOLEST wheels are twice as wide so they roll easily and don't sink in.
               ESSENTIAL STORAGE
There are certain essentials you need for any outdoor gathering so why not have a built in cubby to store them?  The COOLEST has storage for a half dozen reusable plastic plates, which also double as a cutting board for the ceramic rust-proof pairing knife.  
                SPLIT LID and DIVIDER
The COOLEST has a split lid design so you can get access to ice for the blender without letting too much warm air in.  This also lets you keep your cups in the cup holders so you don't have to put everything on the ground just to grab another cold drink.
The split lid design and removable divider give you some great packing options.  You can keep your cocktail ice separate from your regular ice. Or you could put ice only on one side, pull the drain plug and the other side becomes a totally dry refrigerator, perfect for keeping sandwiches and any other perishable food cool and dry.
                       BOTTLE OPENER
How many hours of your life have been wasted or teeth chipped because someone walked off with the bottle opener.  My grandpa's cooler had a bottle opener and so does the COOLEST.
THE STORY
I’m always looking to maximize my fun when I get together with my family and friends. That’s why I am so passionate about the COOLEST. I invent lots of things, but other than my Jello-shot catapult very few have brought so much fun to my life. ;)
I know firsthand how much fun it is to have a cooler with speakers, and a portable blender for beachside margaritas, because I built myself one of each around ten years ago. Last year I reexamined these well-loved creations and realized just how much room for improvement there was. 
What's next?
I have manufactured and brought other products to market, but for a project of this size and complexity I'll be using a pool of experts in the field to make sure the COOLEST lives up to it’s name.
The professional sourcing company I've partnered with has manufactured other coolers, as well as high tech gear. They have an experienced team in the field to assist with quality control, shipping and and other logistics. 
We want you to have your COOLEST as soon as possible. Here’s our plan to achieve that:
July/August: Make lots of new Kickstarter friends, execute manufacturing agreements/standards
September:Finalize the engineering and prototype iterations and place the tooling orders
October:  Tooling build-out and procurement of raw materials and components
November: Part qualification and pre-production builds, pilot production, quality assurance and product validation
December: Begin manufacturing for the injection molded and blow-molded parts
January/February: Finalize the assembly and shipment process and begin fulfillment
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No one wants to see a good idea executed poorly, especially one called the COOLEST. We have worked extremely hard to ready this product for Kickstarter and full-scale manufacturing and fulfillment, but here are what I see as the risks:


MANUFACTURING: Creating the tooling to manufacture a product of this size is expensive and requires expert knowledge to get it right. There is typically a 60 day lead time to create the molds for a product of this size and this is where delays could occur. To minimize that possibility we're working with tooling manufacturers partners with a track record for prompt quality.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: As the COOLEST gets geared up for production, there will likely be some minor adjustments to improve the final product. Pre-production prototypes are made to test and refine the product and allow us to incorporate our adjustments and those suggested by experienced manufacturing partners. These will always be for the benefit of you, the consumer, and we will let you know exactly how and why any are made.

FULFILLMENT: Sometimes things go awry that can’t be planned for: a supplier misses a deadline, a machine breaks down, or a shipment gets lost. Those things could cause a delay. To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will enter the manufacturing stage with at least one back-up supplier for each component pre-located and my product commercialization experts will help ensure smooth sailing from our suppliers and factories.

We will be working with manufacturers who have years of experience delivering excellent products in tremendous quantities. There will no doubt be some surprises along the road, but any obstacle will be addressed by combining our internal knowledge with external expertise, and an overall goal of making the best possible product for you, our COOLEST customer.

Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us make the coolest idea the COOLEST product by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or by helping us spread the word by sharing our page.

We raise a red solo cup of blended goodness in your honor, and say THANK YOU for your help!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
I hope you’re having an awesome summer enjoying life outdoors!
A HUGE thank you to all those who supported us this summer so far with the Guaranteed Shipping options. I’m happy to say we’ve delivered on sending over 5,500 Coolests to you all last month and we’re excited to see your posts as you received your Coolest.

Hey Backers,
I hope everyone is having a great summer so far, and I’m pleased to announce that as of last Friday all 5,000+ Coolest shipped out to those folks who chose to participate in our last Guaranteed Shipping option. We also shipped over 500 Backer units last month made possible by June sales. Next update will be on or before August 12 so we can run the numbers on July sales and share the expected shipping quantities for this month.

Hey Backers,
I’m happy to announce that we successfully shipped all 10,400 Coolest Coolers as promised to those Backers who opted for the $97 option… just in time for the 4th of July weekend!
We are so grateful to each and every one of you who believed in us and were able to help fund the balance of the cost to get your Coolest made and shipped this month.

Hey Backers,
Here’s this week’s shipping progress update.
So far this month we've shipped approximately 5,100 units in every color from our recent $97 expedited shipping option. In general, we're working from East to West coast to account for delivery times from Portland, and give the best chance that all are received in time for the 4th of July.

Hey Backers,
The good news is that the first container of Coolest Coolers arrived in port, passed through customs, was processed by our distribution center and are on the way to 1,800 backers who participated in the $97 Option. Three semi trucks of Coolests have left the distribution center headed out to UPS hubs across the country, and backers will receive a shipping notification from UPS directly prior to delivery. More containers are on the water and will arrive in port later this week and we are on track to ship out all 10,000+ by June 28th, as promised.

Hey Backers,
This week the remaining 2,870 Coolest Coolers (mostly green, some orange) were produced this week and are scheduled to ship out on Sunday.  This means that barring any cargo ship catastrophe, train troubles, or semi truck slip-up all 10,000 Coolest Coolers will make our shipping deadline and arrive before July 4th!
When your Cooler leaves PDX next month you'll get a UPS notification from us.

campaign.story:
We're on a journey to Empower Women, Protect Forests and Improve Health and Happiness around the world.
This KickStarter is just the beginning, but it's a great start, all thanks to you! As a result of this campaign, we will train and equip more than 120 GoSun Stoves to families in need.

If you would like to order a GoSun you can still do so from our website. If you would like to sell, distribute, or propose a partnership with our game-changing technology send us a message here. 
To track us as we lead a global solar cooking revolution follow us on Facebook and Twitter or jump on our newsletter (twice a month, valuable content).

   GoSun Stove Online     I      Facebook      I      Twitter      I      Newsletter
WHAT OTHERS ARE SAYING ABOUT GoSun: 
Tree Hugger - "It is absolutely brilliant for a number of reasons, and is going to change the way we think about solar cooking."
Grist - "We’re usually pretty skeptical about Kickstarters, but we can’t resist fangirling a bit about this one."
Inhabitat - "This uber awesome tube stove can cook delicious meals without using a lick of fuel – in just 20 minutes."
 Fast: Cooks a meal in as little as 20 minutes, utilizing every drop of sunshine
Portable: Pre-assembled package, deploy in seconds, weighing less than 4lbs 
Versatile: Cook what you want and how you want. Bake, boil and fry; if there's sun, you're good to go.
Fuel Free and Clean: No burning charcoal embers to dispose of, no open flame to worry about. When you are done cooking, just fold up your GoSun and go.
Summer or Winter:  If there is sunlight, you are cooking, even after a snow; plus, the wind won't steal your heat
Keeps Food Hot For Hours: Our evacuated tube technology is in essence a giant thermos. This means that when spotty clouds arrive, the tube will remain hot and steadily cook between sun-breaks. Plus, it keeps your brownies warm for hours until a late night snack.
Designed for simplicity, durability, and mobility, the GoSun offers a convenient, user friendly package for our fast paced lives. The GoSun is as simple in principle as it is powerful, effectively retaining 80-90% of all sunlight that is caught in its footprint. The technology relies on the principles of parabolic reflection, evacuation (for its insulating value) and the Greenhouse effect, to make the most advanced solar cooking device to date. 
The GoSun will passively work its magic whenever the sun is shining.  Water can be heated and hot meals can be prepared with a little patience even on the coldest winter day.  A vacuum between two layers of tough glass prevents the outside ambient temperature from transferring into the inner cooking zone.
Proof of a meal in 20 minutes with sunshine (1:07 video)
How to use the GoSun (45 second video)
Why solar cooking?
 Traditional grilling is a lengthy, tedious process involving dirty and bulky equipment.  Grills are rarely portable and, when they are, they typically involve handling extremely hot and messy equipment. Nothing in today’s market is eco‐friendly, efficient, innovative or stylish.  The existing solar ovens are insufficient for today’s fast- paced lifestyle; they are too big, too slow and not user friendly. 
That is why we developed the GoSun Stove!
Our analysis comparing the GoSunStove to portable and stationary propane grills, charcoal grills and camping stoves shows the GoSunStove ranking most desirable based on capacity, ease of use, cost, speed, style, safety, and versatility.
Making Converts with GoSun MINI (35 second video)
What we will do with the money: 
We are a perfect project for KickStarter, because we honestly need this money to set up production, thus meeting minimum order quantities. We've put a ton of time and money in at this point and we're prepared for the exciting road ahead.  Your backing gives us what we need to put the gears in motion.
Tools, Labor, Materials and Shipping: 77% of funds To bring you the GoSun Stove at a reasonable price, we are producing in China - where over 90% of the world's evacuated tubes originate. We're using high quality materials and tooling up with expensive jigs, dies and formers.  Adam Moser, our Chinese Liaison, is committed to working with our experienced manufacturer who respects both the product, their employees and the environment.  
Empowerment Program: 11.5% of funds We are committed to empowering others with our game changing technology. In coordination with a number of international partners (including Sonlight Power, Friends of Belle Riviere, Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves) we aim to first educate, then provide a version of the GoSun especially built for the needs of the developing world. The GoSun Empowerment Program is committed to spreading this technology in a socially, environmentally, and financially sustainable way.
Market Development: 7.5% of funds There is a great opportunity for this innovative cooking technology but we will have to get the GoSun in front of people to share the light.  Barriers to this new school solar cooking such as recipe modification and conforming to a tubular shape will have to be addressed through our media and on-the-ground presence.  We'll be attending events, producing videos, gathering data, tackling problems and training GoSun Ambassadors to facilitate the switch to cooking with the sun.
Educational Material: 4% of funds The children are the future and so is renewable energy.  We are going to develop  products and curriculum to meet national educational standards for classrooms - 3rd through 8th grade.   
Designers, Humanitarians and Solar Oveneers
Patrick Sherwin: Founder and Solar Energy Expert, is passionate about play, yet remains focused on solutions for our time. A veteran solar engineer with extensive small business, international project management, and sales experience.  Patrick’s love for humanity, entrepreneurial spirit and determination will drive the company and its capabilities in all business facets.
Matt Gillespie: Lead Industrial Designer and innovative artist brings a fresh, sensible perspective.  Matt is a post-industrial designer who focuses his talents to address the big picture. Having helped found a successful ecological literacy education nonprofit (This-Land) and bamboo bicycle business (Ozon Cyclery), Matt brings a critical eye and passion to all projects he touches.
Adam Moser: Chinese Liaison and General Counsel, will provide legal counsel, tackle logistical and strategic challenges, interface with the manufacturer and develop international relations. Fluent in Mandarin and well versed in Chinese culture.  Current Assistant Director at US-China Partnership for Environmental Law at Vermont Law School.
Buildmore Workshop: A rapid prototyping facility equipped the very best tools and expertise needed to complete any project you can dream up.  Set up like a Health Club for inventors, engineers, artists, crafters and hackers, Buildmore Workshop has been instrumental in the GoSun Stove's evolution.
Social and Environmental Benefits:
Gender Equality and Women's Rights - less time and resources spent gathering fuel and making fires, increasing time for education and development                                                                                     
Environmental Sustainability - by reducing the need for wood and charcoal, the GoSun will slow deforestation, soil loss, desertification                                                       
Indoor Air Quality - by eliminating much of the need for indoor cooking fires, the GoSun will reduce smoke inhalation, the second leading cause of death globally                                                                                                        
Renewable Energy Access and Education - the GoSun is often the foot-in-the-door for a more solar fueled life                                                           
Energy Security - off-the-grid, self reliance, independence                                                                
No Child Left Inside - getting outdoors to stop Nature Deficiency Disorder
Where are we now:
The GoSun team has created over 30 prototypes over the last few years of development; most have been put to the test and critiqued by peers.  We have demoed the GoSun Stove to several large gatherings (Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival, Ingenuity Fest, Hacker Faire, etc.) in front of thousands of people; many whom ask "how much?" and "where can I buy one?"  
We've been building the GoSun in small quantities by hand, and we cannot keep up with the interest.  Recently having developed our best designed and replicable model, we've developed relationships with a manufacturer in China.  We are ready to pull the trigger on our first production run and will be boarding a plane to China directly after this KickStarter.  While there we will set up quality control and assembly operations.     
STRETCH GOALS:  For all backers purchasing a GoSun Stove or better once funding goals are met - Please share to make these a reality!
For the FINAL 48 HOURS of this campaign we will DOUBLE the amount of GoSun Stoves for the Empowerment Program = We Sell 5 - Then Gift 2!!  Watch the Video (90 seconds)

Standard Package Includes:  an evacuated tube cooking chamber, two parabolic reflectors that protect the tube like a clamshell, a cooking tray with handle for getting food in and out, a simple cleaning scrubby to use when needed and a carrying handle that becomes a set of support legs which can be used to adjust the tube to face the sun in any position along two axis'.
Warranty: 2 year generous warranty.  The evacuated tube oven is made of glass - It’s  pretty tough like Pyrex, but it can break.  We’re ensuring your satisfaction with a Two-Year No-Questions-Asked-Warranty; if you break it for any reason, we will cover the cost of a new tube.   The rest of the package is guaranteed from manufacturing defects for one year.   
Shipping:  The cost of shipping is already included for all Kickstarter backers in the Continental US. For other locations, please add the international shipping cost listed or contact us to get a shipping quote. Note that we cannot predict nor are responsible for any tariff, tax, VAT, or other charges you may incur for international shipments to your location.
THANK YOU FOR GIVING US THE GO !!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
International Shipping:
We may have to work through some kinks in the international shipping department. Costs are variable, so we'll do our best to communicate with you regarding customs, delivery dates, and additional expenses that may apply.

Breakage: 
We are sending a glass tube via standard shipping methods and we could have issues with damages. The tubes are made of a tough glass and we are designing a sturdy cardboard box to handle the dings in route to you. If your tube breaks, we will send you a new one with minimal S/H fee.
 
Manufacturing: 
We've built over 30 prototypes by hand so we're very familiar with the process, materials and tools needed. We don't anticipate problems with our manufacturing partners, but we will inspect and perform quality control measures before the product reaches you.

Cultural Adoption: 
When working with people in need, we will have to carefully transfer this new cooking technology. The GoSun Stove is very new and we have proven its performance. Along with our non-profit partners, we will work to educate and integrate this technology where the market is interested and capable.

campaign.story:
Hello everyone, thanks for checking out my project!  If you missed the Kickstarter campaign, you can view STRONG LIKE BULL products available at www.stronglikebullmagnets.com
In funding project updates:
1) A stainless steel part will be inserted into the 'jaw' area to make sure this opener truly lasts a lifetime... more details can be found in Update #7.
2) A cool packakaging tin is being offered as an add-on... more details can be found in update #10.
Bottle openers are certainly well covered territory on Kickstarter.  My recently unsucessful Bottlejak stopper project incorporated a bottle opener feature, and I found it fun to use.   And so, it led me to sketch up a few pages full of opener concepts... along with many pages of ideas as equally unusual as the Bottlejak... but the world does not appear quite ready for those just yet:) 
Kickstarters love bottle openers...
Made in the Carolinas!
-There have been a few 'small format' openers of various types... I own the very nice Torq from creator Mike Bond.
-There have been lots of 'pocket tools' featuring openers.  I own the Bottle Grenade from creator Brad and the Pickpocket from creator Michael Dickson.. these are cool designs.
-There have been wall mounted openers, stick on openers, and even a bike seat post opener.
So again, well covered ground, but I still wanted to give it a go...
I always try to be as unique and original as possible.  I received a lot of positive feedback from my previous Strong Like Bull Magnet project... backers interested in where I could go with the 'brand'.  I also had many backers say they liked Bottlejak and it's opener feature.. so I decided to kind of combine those elements into the STRONG LIKE BULL bottle opener project.
There are lots of cool machined-from-sheetmetal type products on KS.  So I thought if I made a really substantial sized, hand held opener, then that would be a fun new direction.  Something you'll have a hard time losing, something to throw in your kitchen drawer or display on your bar top. 
I thought I was on to something, but then I found the successfully funded 'Beer Claw'... this project is more of what I wanted to do from a size perspective, but it's a very rustic wood and metal design and I was more interested in a modern clean metal look. So I thought my eventual design was a different enough direction to pursue.  
Feels great, all edges are beveled
Design Time...
I wanted substantial, so 1/2 inch thick aluminum was the starting point.  From there, I took some inspiration from some knife handle designs and created a prominent spot for the SLB logo.  I'm happy with the result... I think it looks great, works great, and feels great.
Making It...
Starting with a block of aluminum, there's a great amount of machining to produce the final part which clocks in at 4.5oz.  Aluminum is pretty lightweight... so when you have 4.5oz of it, you've got a pretty big piece of aluminum.  The overall length is over 6 inches and the width approaches 2 inches at the widest part.
The logo is stamped on both sides.
With your support, the funding from the project will allow for a large enough order to get the pricing to a reasonable level.  As always, I utilize local, US machine and anodizing shops to allow me to be involved in overseeing the production.
Finishes...
I plan to offer several anodized color options.  Anodizing is an electrochemical process that converts the metal surface into a decorative, durable, corrosion-resistant finish.
Depending on how funding goes, I'll offer several anodize colors... more details on this as the project moves along.  
Keep it handy...
The SLB Bottle Opener is designed to allow a SLB magnet to fit in the handle to allow it to be stuck to a metal surface.  Hang it on your refrigerator or grill to keep it handy.
If you have a SLB magnet from my last project, then you are all set... if not, I have configured a reward that includes the opener and 1 SLB magnets of your choice.  
Where the rewards money goes...
While not inexpensive... it's a large, one-of-a-kind, custom machined part that will pretty much last forever.  Here's a look at where the reward money goes...
Thanks for checking out the project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If the project achieves funding, it will be my third successfully funded project. I've learned quite a bit on the first two projects... Spoke Pencils and Strong Like Bull Magnets. Those two projects were reasonably on time and well received. Every project has potential for issues, but with the experience from the prior projects and the prototyping that has already been done on this one, I'm confident I can execute the project (ship in time for the holidays). I hope to get the chance to do just that. Thanks! Brian

updates.update_content:
Hello All... I hope this message finds you well!
Just a quick note to let you know my latest Kickstarter project has launched!  If interested, you can check out the details here...

Hello, Brian here...I hope this note finds you well!
I've been working on a couple of new interesting and unique magnet projects.... but they are just not quite ready to go just yet. I wanted to do a Kickstarter project for the end of the year… one that will deliver in December. For me, it adds a bit to the holiday season feeling when you get to pack and ship a bunch of boxes! 
Given it’s November tomorrow… I needed a project to be a Quick-starter… something that would require minimal funding, something that I could execute quickly, and ideally something that would be gift-able. Around two weeks ago, I stumbled upon an idea… I bought a bulk pack of Post-its and it came with a free plastic holder. I didn't care for the way it looked on my desk, so i decided to make a custom one... and thought maybe some others would like one too. Under my 'Spoke Design' brand...

updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone… 
I hope this update finds you well! I’m back with another try at funding a fun project…

Very sorry for the back-to-back updates, but I unfortunately reported the ring spike launch date incorrectly... it's tomorrow, 2/13, at noon EST.
Best,  
Brian

Hello everyone… 
I hope this message finds you well! For 2015 I had one simple resolution. I bought a ‘sketch a day’ notebook and resolved to sketch up an idea a day in 2015. After 20 days in, I decided to take one of the more straightforward ideas and make it a little Kickstarter project. More on that in a bit… 
I’ve backed off doing ‘shout out’ mentions a good bit due to the volume of requests, but I wanted to highlight a couple cool projects I am supporting that could use some funding help.

Hello Everyone… I hope this message finds you well… there’s lots to update!
I finished up the Strong Like Bull Throw Magnet project last month and they are available on the site (www.stronglikebullmagnets.com). There’s now a fun little offshoot of that. As I’ve chronicled in project updates, my biggest ‘launch’ ever happened earlier this year… my oldest daughter went off to college. She tells me the throw magnet game is really popular with those who visit her dorm. So, to encourage the entrepreneurial spirit in my daughter, we came up with ‘Strong Like Ram’ for her to dabble with (when she’s not studying). While it’s targeted at UNC folks, I think she’s done a good job with the site and if interested you can check it out her handiwork here… .

Hello Everyone!
Yes, I’m still around… and I’m up for a new project funding attempt. Before those details, here’s a quick rundown of what’s new on the previous project fronts… 
Spoke Pencils… I’ve now got the new ‘double dot’ model in colors (including orange) available on the website… those interested can check it out here… www.spokepencils.com
SLB Magnets… I was going to do a STRONG LIKE BULL XL Magnet… but I decided against a project attempt that’s just a larger version of a previous one… a bit too boring. I do however think the SLB XL is a cool product… some folks have asked for it… I said I was going to do it… and so I did. The SLB XL is now available on the website ... So if you’re interested, you can check it out there.

Hello Everyone…
I hope 2014 is treating everyone well!
I get a lot of messages from previous backers asking what I’ve been up to… so now’s an opportune time for an update as there are a few things going on…
First… a big shout out to my brother Dan who has just launched his second KS project… the Bakon Baker. Mmmm bacon… the candy of meats! Dan has come up with a simple product that allows for oven cooking of bacon without a lot of fuss or mess. If you are a bacon fan, it really works well so definitely check out the project!

campaign.story:
A premium athletic sleeve for people who get out with their gadgets — iPhone® (4, 4s, 5) and iPod®. Pat. Pending. Designed with your body in mind.
Unique fit compression sleeve — No buckles or winching down on the arm.
Patent-pending design — a translucent fabric window that you can actually see and operate your touch screen through! Allows water vapor to escape instead of trapping it like impermeable plastics do.
A movement to elevate expectations — better products that are designed for people instead of their gadgets.
Silver smart fabrics that clean themselves;
Fabric window to see and operate the touch screen through so the phone stays dry;
Worn over forearm so you can exercise without stopping when changing songs and answering calls;
Fashion that calls more attention to you than to your phone.

We love to run and ride. But we want to stay connected. Our phones have to go the distance with us. Regular armbands just don’t pass muster. We found a lot of people who, like us, weren’t impressed with what we found on store shelves. Here is what a few said:
Change was needed. We wanted a premium armband that was easy to use and provided a comfortable experience. Our approach sets us apart. We went to the Kona triathlon trail to run, ride, and make a product for real people. Instead of following competitor trends and fashions, we created a product we would buy.
Elevate your training and benefit from improved circulation, superior moisture wicking fabric construction that keeps you dry, and self-cleaning fabrics. Flatlock seam construction provides smooth comfort all the way to the finish line. Always washable. With easy access to your smart device. An extra pocket inside for your credit card / ID and a little cash.
Elevate represents a commitment to exceptional construction and the finest materials.
Polyester / nylon base keeps you dry by pulling moisture away from the skin and pushing it to a nylon surface where it dries fast.
Finish treatment of ionized silver kills bacteria and fungus (and the funky smells they can produce).
Plush elastic upper and lower edges for the most comfortable compression fit.
Flat lock construction that feels great against the skin.
Designed in America.
Elevate is a compression garment. Check your size using the guide below.*
Appx. Length: 8 inches (20.32 cm)
Appx. Weight: .5 ounces (14.17 grams)
Materials: Base Layer—Nylon / Polyester / Lycra | Window—Nylon / Lycra | Elastic Edges—Polyester / Rubber
Standard Colors: Black & Orange
Premium Colors: Red Sky, Trail Green, Blue Ocean, Silver Sheen
Cleaning Instructions: Wash in cool / mild water with like colors. Mild dry cycle or hang dry. Expected garment life of 100 washes (or about 1 year).
*When you order, select the offering category you want. We will email a survey after our campaign to collect your colors and sizes so you have a few days to think over which ones you want.
Get your custom logo printed on your band. Good for teams and friend gifts. We offer two printing options: sides or bottom. Select one you like. Logos can be color or black / white. Your call. A survey will go out after the campaign to take your color preference.
Customized performance athletic shirts for the road. Shirts come in two colors: black or silver. Sized separately for male and female: S, M, L, XL, XXL.
from left to right: Alyssa Guerrero: like winnowing chaff, she refines all our work with her eye for detail. An island girl from Guam, a US territory in the Pacific, Alyssa moved to the mainland to pursue her career in graphic design. When she's not working on fashion, graphic layout, and packaging, she's designing our branding. Shane McMullin: an award-winning short film artist who handles all aspects of our commercial media. He got his start in cinema and video production. In 2003, he started NINTH HOUR Productions, a full-service production house in Greenville, SC. Shane has worked on feature films, promotionals, and corporate pieces to name a few. His entrepreneurial mind and creativity lets us tell our story as it deserves to be told. David Williams: product designer, customer advocate, and manufacturing. David founded Comfe Designs in 2011 with a unique product for tablets after exiting a career in software. An entrepreneur at heart, he setup manufacturing in the US and focuses on marketing / selling worldwide. David handles product development, organizing contracts and making sure our suppliers can meet our customers' demands. Zach Halleck: graphic design, sports fashion, and branding. Zach can develop graphics for any surface. He launched his career by creating branding for technology companies. His latest project is marrying his sweetheart. Peter Waldschmidt: business and technology. Two things describe him: behind-the-scenes and hands-on. Peter's background is startups, software and engineering. After selling TetraData, which he cofounded with 2 partners, Peter has gone on to launch several successful tech ventures.
Thank you for supporting us!
Q1 > What about other devices? If you have a different device and would still like an Elevate sleeve, please let us know by sending an email with your device name and version. We'll put the device and the number of requests daily at the top of the page. If we get >=25 requests for any one device, we'll add it to the list.
Q2 > Will the sleeve fit my big / small arm? It’s a compression fit, and we have most standardized sizes available for women and men. To be sure we have your size, refer to the sizing chart and measure your arm with a flexible tape measure. On the other hand, if you make Arnold Schwarzenegger look like a girly man, just shoot us an email and we’ll try accommodate your size.
Q3 > I have a big case. Will my device fit? Thin cases should do fine. But Elevate is not designed for a giant case. If you've got a big case like an OtterBox®, it may fit depending on the model. If we get >=25 requests for a model that accommodates big cases, we can make it. Please email if that's your preference!
Apple, iPhone, and iPod are trademarks of Apple, Inc. OtterBox is a trademark of Otter Products. No endorsement given or implied.
Elevate Armsleeve is brought to you by Comfe Designs, LLC. Patent Pending. TM and ©2013 Comfe Designs LLC. All Rights Reserved.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In short, we’re ready to begin. This is our second time designing and manufacturing products. We've spent considerable time lining up manufacturing and suppliers to make sure you're getting the best—suppliers that cater to major name brands with athletic apparel, military hardware, and even medical-grade equipment.

The biggest risk for us is not starting with enough capital and support from you to help us get the word out. That’s why we’re bringing this to Kickstarter. Second, we have to nail down a final contract with our intended manufacturer and get sewing. That takes money and plenty of due diligence to make sure you're getting the best quality. To mitigate this risk, we have several manufacturers we're vetting in case one doesn't deliver what we're asking for. There are several quality textile operations still in the south east, and throughout North America. As soon as we reach our funding goal, we should be able to start manufacturing. The material supplier provides on-demand fabrication; they're ready to rock and roll!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

David Williams
2 created · 1 backed
I started Comfe Designs in 2011 after leaving a career in computer technology. The idea was simple—reshape an industry marked by low...See more

updates.update_content:
Dear Fans and Customers, 
Can you guess why am I so excited right now?
Today we finished shipping our first round and are sold out of all but the XL sizes! If you've been wondering what has happened since we shipped to you, you'll want to keep reading.
Where we've been (with pictures)

I felt compelled to write this letter to all my Kickstarter viewers, friends and backers after hearing of the death of the late Robin Williams, one of my favorite actors.
Has anyone told you lately that you've got potential? I wish more people had told me that while finishing my newest product, Elevate.
Almost every week I felt the sting of discouragement (and still do) because there were so many mistakes to learn from. Frustration sets in as mistakes compound over time. When it does, reason and emotion can feel crippled.
Through the development process, I have learned that mistakes are life's way of humbling us so we can keep learning. If we're not learning, we're not moving. And staying in the same place yields the same result as quitting. While setbacks can seem like failure, they're actually the path to success. They're necessary. Not evil. Whatever setbacks you face today, don't quit. You can overcome.

Looking for a followon to this project? 
Here's what we've done since canceling our campaign last year, and what's next since we shipped our first production.
WHAT WE'VE DONE

campaign.story:
This video is re-purposed from its initial creation as an audition for the reality show Food Network Star, Season 8, on the Food Network channel. Since I discovered the submission deadline was looming and I had no one to shoot me doing a cooking demo, I did the best I could to portray myself as talented and colorful, edgy and creative--as well as a foodie. But you can see in it my references to my past publishing projects, some of them highly successful (e.g., The Midtown Messenger newspaper created for the historic districts of central Phoenix, AZ, which I published for 96 straight months--October 2001 through September 2009. Visit The Midtown Messenger, where you can download complete issues through early 2003 and read selected content on departmental pages, as well as my bio on the "About Us" page.) Thanks for viewing/reading.
BTW, while I thought it was important for the paper to have an online presence, I strongly believe in the primacy of print--an attitude borne out by the fact that the website was little-visited, thus I discontinued updating it. For some republished content from the paper (as well as other extraneous material, including samples of "Fake News" and later film criticism, visit the associated blog, midtownphoenix.blogspot.com).
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating compelling content and formatting it into a publication is one thing. I believe I have the skills and vision to do so par excellence. The tough part is establishing an effective circulation (free distribution) plan, and getting solid ongoing financial support and profitability in the form of an advertiser base.

In Phoenix, I paid a marketing company for door-to-door delivery of the paper in a reasonably compact geographical area, as well as delivering to bulk pickup sites myself. With a paper I started in north-central Arizona (Prescott), where the territory was more dispersed, I learned the ins and outs of getting the pieces mailed via rural route carrier.

As for advertising, I am experienced at recruiting, motivating and training/coaching independent ad reps. I wrote a whole (sample) chapter of a proposed "how to publish your own local paper" book on that topic. What's tough is finding a good rep--they're rare. And so is getting "hurting" and shrewd small business owners to part with their money on advertising, in a tough economy. But with a track record--samples of past projects--compelling content (some very topical but "evergreen" stories already written), and the fact that there is a robust publishing scene in the region (one just has to make a good case for a newcomer publication), I have the insight, chutzpah and persistence to make it pay.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Imagine a vertical underwater garden: seaweed and mussels grow on floating ropes, stacked above oyster and clam cages below. Imagine a farm designed to restore rather than deplete our oceans - a farm growing local food but also biofuel and organic fertilizer.
We're doing it!

Last year we integrated seaweed into our existing shellfish farm, becoming the first 3D ocean farm in Long Island Sound. Although still small scale, our experiment has attracted attention, including from the Wall Street Journal, National Geographic, The New Yorker, and NPR.

Now it’s time to scale up
Here’s Why It’s a Game Changer:
As lifelong commercial fishermen, we know our oceans are in trouble. Overfishing has wiped out 90% of large fish; climate change is driving everything from lobsters to whales northward; nitrogen pollution is triggering ever-expanding dead zones.
But we can turn the tide. We've invented a 3D model of ocean farming designed to grow seaweed and shellfish to provide healthy, local food - but also reduce overfishing, help mitigate climate change and restore ocean ecosystems. Here's how: 
Eat Like a Fish! Growing Local Food to Reduce Overfishing:  We're re-imagining the dinner plate by eating what fish eat: plants. We're cooking up kelp linguini, kelp ice cream - even kelp cocktails - and already on the menu at il Buco, Morimoto's and other elite NYC restaurants. So it's fun, but also healthy: our seaweeds contain more protein than soybeans and more calcium than milk. Plus fish don't make Omega-3’s - they consume them. So by eating like fish, consumers get the same benefits, while reducing pressure on dwindling fish stocks.
Pickled Kelp, Crostini w/ Kelp Butter and Thimble Island Clams
Scaled up, the potential impact on our food system is mind-blowing. In a 300’ x 300’ plot we can grow 24 tons of seaweed in 5 months. Creating a network of small seaweed farms equaling the size of Washington State could provide enough protein to feed the world. Of course we’re not all going to become ocean vegetarians, but it shows our model can have a real impact on our stressed food systems.
Restoring Our Oceans: Two years ago while out on the boat, a light bulb went off: We realized that millions of years ago, Mother Nature invented two species - kelp and shellfish - designed to restore ocean ecosystems and mitigate climate change. And these are two species we can grow! Here's how our 3D model is a game-changer:
Climate Change: Carbon is a root cause of acidification, rising water temps and other climate-related threats to our oceans. The kelp we grow -- known as the “rainforest of the sea” -- absorbs five times more carbon than land-based plants. Our 20 acre farm alone has the potential to remove 134 tons of carbon a year. So we're not just fishermen - we're climate farmers.
Water Quality: Shellfish and seaweed act as filters, drawing out nitrogen. While an important nutrient for humans, excess nitrogen from agricultural runoff is creating ever-expanding dead zones in our coastal waters. Kelp and oysters need nitrogen to grow, so our farm - which soaks up to 164 kg of nitrogen a year - is vital for restoring water quality. Then, after we've soaked up the nitrogen, we turn our kelp into liquid fertilizer for local organic farmers.
Biofuel: We’re working with a team of scientists and engineers to grow kelp biofuel. On our farm alone it’s possible to grow up to 2000 gallons of biofuel per acre. According to the US Department of Energy, a network of kelp farms totaling an area ½ the size of Maine could grow enough biofuel to replace all of the oil in the US.
Restoring Habitat: The gear we use - ranging from longlines to underwater cages - function as artificial reefs, attracting over 150 species that come to hide, eat and thrive. After a decade of farming, what was once a barren patch of ocean is now a robust ecosystem. Plus our gear functions as storm surge protectors, helping mitigate the impacts of extreme weather events, like the swamping of NYC by Hurricane Sandy.
Creating Blue-Green Jobs: From Newfoundland to Louisiana, boats are beached and fish plants idled. These communities need blue-green jobs. That's why we’ve designed our model to be replicated so that any person with 20 acres and a boat can start their own 3D farm, then scale up. Every component of our model will be open source and available on the web.
What We Need To Scale Up
We currently have two 150ft longlines growing seaweed and mussels. After over a year of experimenting, we know our design works. Now we need to expand by adding 10 more longlines so we can grow over 26 tonnes of kelp in five months and 60,000 mussels.
Our goal is to raise $30,000 for purchasing and installing these 10 new floating longlines systems. If funded, we will allocate:
$12,000 for buying anchors and chain systems strong enough to withstand hurricanes;
$3,000 for buoys, lines and other gear;
$8,000 for installation and labor; and
$7,000 for licensing fees and marine engineering consulting services.
If we beat our $30,000 goal and raise $50,000 we will create an educational program to train the next generation of 3D ocean farmers. Then we'll take our model on the road, as a catalyst for the creation of a network of local ocean farms, growing food-fuel-fertilizer while reducing carbon emissions and restoring our ocean ecosystems. Imagine seaweed and shellfish integrated into wind farms, fish plants re-opened to process restorative food and coal plants re-purposed to process kelp biofuel.
But we need your help. Together we can save our seas and ourselves. Join us to jump start the blue revolution!
What's for Dinner?
Kelp Fettucine with Crab and Uni Butter
Pork Belly with Kelp Salad
Kelp & Horseradish Aquavit, Honey, Lemon
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Possible delays: Licensing is always a challenge. We were the first vertical ocean farm granted permits in Long Island Sound -- and it took 3 years. However, we have already completed a round of meetings with state regulators - who have guaranteed that amending our permit will take less than 6 months. 

The other challenge with ocean farming is extreme weather events such as Hurricane Sandy. To mitigate potential damage we have budgeted for a design that can withstand hurricane-level winds.

We've installed the anchors, chain and buoys for seven new longlines with a volunteer team and couple of large barges. It's all underwater so there’s not much to see, but here’s a picture of your low-impact restorative 3D ocean farm! Oh, how beautiful...

campaign.story:
Did you know that:
America has one of the lowest breastfeeding rates in the world?
Breastfeeding empowers women?
Preemies do much better when they spend more time on their mama's chest than in an incubator?
Other countries are more advanced in their birth and breastfeeding policies than the US?
Our own Milky Way galaxy was named for Mother's Milk?
We are raising the necessary funds to complete, market and release a feature-length documentary film about breastfeeding into the world to educate and inspire. Jennifer and Chantal are RN lactation consultants that want to make an impact on American culture and in the lives of mothers. We need your help to make this dream a reality.
The Milky Way! is a film that needs to be made. We invite you to become part of our vision. This is your chance to make a tremendous difference in the lives of women.
Our Mosaic Project:
Every mother has a story. What's your story? A picture is worth a thousand words, add yours to the Mosaic, where da Vinci's classic nursing mother is brought into the 21st Century. Each mother-baby or nursing photo is a "tile" in the mosaic with a pledge of $15 or more. Help us get the 10,000 tiles to make an awesome poster! Post or private message photos to our Facebook page:
  https://www.facebook.com/MilkyWayMovie
The Milky Way will take you on a journey of discovery, and what we find will astonish you. 
Jennifer and Chantal, the producers of The Milky Way, are passionate about empowering mothers. We want women to have accurate information about their bodies and their babies. The Milky Way reveals the real power vested in women’s bodies and how that affects their babies - even the tiniest of preemies. One of the primary goals for the film is to assure women that they have the tools they need to trust their instincts, and to know that each mother is truly the expert regarding her own baby.
Jennifer and Chantal have a profound trust in women's bodies and in babies' capabilities. We view mother and baby as one whole, symbiotic, synergistic, holistic entity, and a mother is the baby's home - its essential habitat. Nursing is a normal, ordinary yet extraordinary, experience.
Our mission is to restore the phenomenon of the nursing mother.
Got a question? Send us a message... We'd love to hear from you.
Our mission is to restore the phenomenon of the nursing mother.
Jennifer Davidson is a pediatric nurse and lactation consultant at the progressive pediatric practice of Dr. Jay Gordon in Santa Monica, CA. Jennifer is frustrated by the ongoing struggle that nursing mothers face. After years of working with mothers and babies, Jennifer recognized a consistent need to provide her clients with essential tools to enable them to trust their instincts, and to know that each mother is truly the expert regarding her own baby.
With the help of her mentor, Chantal Molnar, she embarks on a journey to find the answers, ultimately developing solutions and a movement to restore the Phenomenon of the Nursing Mother to the culture in America.
 What People Are Saying...
Alanis Morsette: Muscian and Breastfeeding Advocate
Nancy Williams, MA, MFT, IBCLC, CCE - Professional Lactation Consultant - Nancy has been providing breastfeeding help and support for 30 years and has been a national speaker for 20. She has been a perinatal educator and consultant since the late 1970's
Professor James J. McKenna is recognized as the world’s leading authority on mother-infant co-sleeping, in relationship to breastfeeding and SIDS.
Minnie Driver: Actress and Breastfeeding Advocate
Carrie-Anne Moss: Actress and Breastfeeding Advocate
Join us on our mission
to elevate the nursing mother to a place in society where she receives all the necessary support to nurse her child, where scientific evidence overrides marketing influences, and a woman does not fear nursing in public.
About The Milky Way
In defiance of nearly a hundred years of medical procedures that routinely separated babies from their mothers, and medical advice that informed women that their milk was not good enough, The Milky Way captures how mothers can access their inner knowledge and trust their own body’s wisdom. Women’s stories, leading lactation professionals, archival footage, religious iconography, and formula advertisements, show how mothers’ authority was co-opted by medical professionals, and how they have been pressured to forfeit their nourishing breasts in favor of highly sexualized breasts.
This film shows how women can reclaim their birthright and restore the nursing mother archetype. The Milky Way is about the knowledge that inherently resides in every woman, how to access that knowledge and how to trust what we already know. It is a film that will inspire women to say, “I can do that!” “I want to do that!
The Milky Way is about the knowledge that inherently resides in every woman, how to access that knowledge and how to trust what we already know. It is a film that will inspire women to say, “I can do that!” “I want to do that!
Mary Cassatt "Louise nursing her child"
Where we are now with the project
Making a film and releasing it into the world takes place in stages.  We are thrilled to have completed the filming process and are now in the editorial stage, where the film really comes to life.  The Milky Way will then be output to DVD and will play the international film festival circuit, where it will be presented to distributors.  Following the festival run, the film will be released through a variety of distribution platforms, kicking off a “movement” that will truly create positive social change.
We are raising the necessary funds to complete, market and release the film into the world. We need your help to make this dream a reality.
The Mythic Origins Of The Milky Way
The Origin of the Milky Way is a painting by the Italian late Renaissance master Jacopo Tintoretto (1575-1580)
Our own Milky Way Galaxy was named after mother’s milk! The word galaxy derives from the Greek term galaxias, "milky one", or kyklos and galaktikos, "milky circle," because it looks a milky spiral in the night sky. In Greek mythology, Zeus places his son, Heracles, born by a mortal woman, on Hera's breast while she is asleep. Zeus wanted the baby to drink her milk so he could become divine. Hera wakes up to an unknown baby nursing at her breast. She unlatches him in surprise, and the milk having let down, sprays across the night sky, creating the Milky Way.
The Filmmakers
Producer Jennifer Davidson RN BSN IBCLC is a pediatric nurse and lactation consultant at the progressive pediatric practice of Dr. Jay Gordon MD in Santa Monica, CA. After years of working with mothers and babies Jennifer recognized a consistent need to provide her clients with essential tools to enable them to trust their bodies, trust their babies, and trust themselves, especially during the early days of new motherhood.
Producer Chantal Molnar RN MA IBCLC worked at University of California, Irvine Medical Center for over 20 years. During those years she saw how damaging medical practices are to breastfeeding, and realized how drastically the culture must change in order for more moms to succeed. She holds a master’s degree in human development.
Director/Producer Jon Fitzgerald has over 20 years of experience in the motion picture business.He co-founded the Slamdance Film Festival in 1995 and went on to direct the AFI Los Angeles Film Festival, Santa Barbara and Abu Dhabi International Film Festivals. After consulting to film festivals and indie filmmakers for many years, he transitioned back into producing, with socially relevant projects, such as THE BACK NINE, THE HIGHEST PASS and DANCE OF LIBERATION and now THE MILKY WAY. In 2011, he launched CineCause, an online portal connecting socially relevant films to related causes.In 2012, he authored Filmmaking For Change: Make Films That Transform the World.
REWARDS
The Milky Way Bracelet that says: “Go Galactic” & “The Milky Way”
The Milky Way Tote Bag
The Milky Way Onesie
The Milky Way Sticker Pack
BOOKS: Stone Age Baby In A Techno World & Sleeping with Your Baby - A Parents Guide to Cosleeping
The Milky Way Baby Wrap
Choice of Mother-Child Art Print
Gustav Klimt
Pablo Picasso
The Milky Way Madonna Supporter Mosaic
For Kickstarter Press Inquiries, please contact Christopher Olenik at: http://agency20.com/contact-us/

What we will use Kickstarter funds for:
With 90% of the film “in the can” there are many things that have to be done in order to finish our film. The actual filming is only part of making a movie. Here are some of the things that we are doing right now, that we are hoping to fund with our Kickstarter campaign: 
 
There are some “pick-up” shots as well as some new people who we have recently discovered that should be in the film. 
Travel - there are a few things we could shoot on location in other countries, if we were able to raise enough money, that would contribute greatly to the film. 
 
Film editing – this is where the film takes shape. Jennifer, Chantal, our director and our editors go through all the footage and pick out the best shots to be used in the film, where they would best be used, etc. In order to edit a movie and finish it we need all of the things listed below and more:

Hardware: Storage drives – we have a lot of footage, and it all has to be converted into hi resolution which takes up tremendous amount of space on a drive and each editor needs their own copy.
Color correction 
Sound editing
Transcriptions
Graphics 
Branding
Logo development and design
Poster development and design
Title design
Sub-titles and translations
Clearance rights 
Musical scoring
Animations – there are several animations that we need to have created for us.
Music licenses – we would love to have Beyonce’s “Halo’ in the film, as well as some other music that we must pay to use.
Attorney fees
Insurance premiums

campaign.story:
Hi KickStarter Supporters:
I'm a great fan of keeping my life portable after growing up in Tokyo, Japan where there is very little space for anything.  I'm on the road a lot, so when something serves multiple needs but takes almost no space- I'm really attracted to it.  I created LapMonkey with these cherished values in mind.  
I wanted something that would serve as a book stand/media holder while I travel that was super portable.  Then I realized my laptop is already a decent book stand with most of the components already there.  However, using my screen as a book rest never felt good because I was worried the screen would get scratched and also many books or sheets of paper would slide off if not braced.  At other times I would be editing the media on the laptop screen with a pen and always felt insecure about the ink somehow getting on the laptop screen.
So I made my first version of LapMonkey out of aluminium corners and a flexible piece of colored plastic which was a good start.  Then I thought, "Hey, why not make it transparent and then maybe I can just leave it on most of the time, which is I actually am doing even while I type this write up.  Later a friend who has does a lot of cross referencing with digital and written material but has a smaller screen asked, can it be designed so it could shift over to the side while being used.  The answer was "yes!", and so I created also the transcription mode.  See video or picture above for details.  
I used plexiglass because it was clear, but I am realizing it is quite strong and so I thought it makes a nice shield and realized it was not a bad idea to keep it on as a safety device in certain settings.  This may include such hazards as careless children with pens, sticky baby hands covered in jam etc., splashing liquid materials that would etch your monitor.  OK, it may etch and scratch the LapMonkey but better destroying a $18 item than a $700 item- wouldn't you say.
As you see I got a prototype made which I use almost everyday, and when I don't, it just tucks away in my laptop carrying bag taking almost no space.  I often leave it on forgetting that it is on there.
Slides right in with your laptop for travelling.
What really needs to happen now is the following:
1)   Getting some funding so this project can be produced efficiently where large orders from my manufacturer can be made to keep the per unit cost down.  
2)  To give about 200 units out to those who are peer leaders in the target market.  My hope is that as people see them use the LapMonkey others will want one too.  To me this target market are those who like to keep their lives portable and light.  Specifically college students, the general education world, and travelling sales people often use a combo of written and digital material.
3)  To advertise it in some travel magazines as funds permit.
4) Supplying retailers with some product support materials that will draw attention to LapMonkey.
5)  To get LapMonkey out enough into the public that it can sell itself so to speak.  I am hoping that within a year things can be set up so that it will just require some residual advertising to keep sales going.
For now, I plan to have part of the product manufactured through laser cutters or routers which for now will be out sourced.  If the support is strong enough it would be something worth looking into purchasing.  
I am also open to hear from those that may want to join me in this vision.  I do feel this is the sentiment of KickStarter and working with others can be a lot more enjoyable and powerful then working on your own so feel free to come as support that way too where we can share our in born qualities to enhance the project.
How much this can be done will depend on how much funding this project raises.  Please join in on my vision if this project inspires you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My concerns are that ideally LapMonkey works best if it is just as wide or slightly wider than the laptop frame. It is not so good if it is narrower than the laptop frame width. This means I may have to have several sizes or at least 2. Still, far as laptops go, the 15.x" and 14.x" represents almost 78% of the market. I feel the LapMonkey which is 14" wide will probably be sufficient for those two sizes, though there may be some issues about it fitting in the case with its laptop bag. Actually if you have a laptop that is 14.x", can you tell me if you think an item that is 14" wide would fit in your laptop bag. Most people laptop bags tend to be a good 1.5 inches wider than their laptops so my hope is that it really will not matter than much. Otherwise, 14% of the market has a 13.x" monitor and I will have to see how efficient it will be to serve that segment. It may end up confusing things to have two sizes, and I am hoping that one size will suffice most of the market. 

The only other thing that concerns me is the physical transparent nature of this product makes it hard to stand out. So I have to figure out ways to present it in such a way that it attracts potential buyers walking by it.

I am resourceful and have the ability to shift a design if it can't be manufactured efficiently so I am confident I can adjust as adversities come up. The simplicity of this product makes things very adjustable and this is a plus. I have found there is always a solution to everything if you give it enough time and effort to work it out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
YOU BLEW ME AWAY!
THANK YOU SO MUCH! Thank you for your generosity, for seeing the potential of this project, for getting Garbanzo and me out of the box in only 24 days, and for getting us that much closer to fully funding this joyous exploration of the power of play. YOU ARE AMAZING! AND I AM SPEECHLESS!
Now that Garbanzo and I are out of the box, we're going to stop watching this page everyday. After all, we've got a movie to make! But if you missed the opportunity to donate during the campaign, it's NEVER TOO LATE! We love and appreciate your support any time. Just go to the SERIOUSLY website and push the donate button. www.seriouslythemovie.com/play
More ways to play
- Again (just in case you missed it), if you still want to make a donation, you can go HERE: http://seriouslythemovie.com/play/
- You can buy some swanky SERIOUSLY! Swag at our store and proceeds will go directly to the film: http://cafepress.com/seriousythemovie
- We'd love to stay in touch with you so please sign up on our mailing list. We'll update you on our progress and let you know about special events. There is so much to come: http://seriouslythemovie.com/play/
- You can still buy tickets to join the crew and donors for a celebratory Rooftop Wine and Twister Party in Oakland on a Sunday afternoon, date tbd (in November) http://seriouslythemovie.com/play/
- Run away and join the Circus Arts Play Day the day before our SF Premiere (9/13). You'll meet our wondrously wacky friends Jefe and Kelly who really KNOW HOW TO PLAY. WATCH THEM HERE. It's a total hoot! Tickets are $150. You can buy them here: http://seriouslythemovie.com/play/
- The future of work is play! I'd love to help you make your workplace more playful! I offer a Keynote, a Teambuilding Training, Coaching services and more. Find out how here: http://seriouslythemovie.com/now-playing-at-work
If you donated we will be contacting you by Oct. 20 to be sure you get your rewards.
I'm so deeply grateful for you and this wild adventure called Kickstarter. You have all helped me remember that the world IS INDEED full of playmates and that EVERYWHERE really IS a playground and that our true nature REALLY IS boundless and free! Thank you for making SERIOUSLY! A movie about PLAY possible.
With a great big mountain of gratitude and delight,
Gwen and the "Team"
Garbanzo, Michael, Priya, Sharath, Audrey, David, Sarah, Elizabeth, Marisa and Chris
*****************
LET'S RAISE $50,000!
If we raise $50,000, we'll be able to make a 30 min. pilot for broadcast, we'll have a really robust proposal for the full-length film, and we'll cover this hot content:
The great video game debate - Are video games making us stupid, crazy, and lonely? Or are they our salvation? The answer isn't simple. I'll include many perspectives and convey the complexity of this issue and what's at stake.
How play heals trauma - Healers share some of the miraculous results they've achieved using play with war veterans, earthquake survivors, and other victims of violence. 
How play creates and heals communities - We'll explore what happens when Arabs and Jews play soccer together, when parents reclaim their neighborhoods from cars, and when whole cities become game boards. 
These are some of my favorite topics and I can't wait to explore them!
THE LATEST SUPER FUN THING
We invited a few of you to send us a short video telling us why you're supporting a movie about play and giving a shout out for Seriously! We cut your pieces together and made THIS super fun piece! 
**************************************************************
Seriously! A Movie About Play
What do a toddler, a neuroscientist, a Yoruban High Priestess, and Wavy Gravy all have in common? You got it (I knew you were smart)! They're all part of a motley chorus making a serious case for the power of play. Add some gripping stories, a promiscuous red ball, and an irrepressible menagerie of playmates and you've got Seriously! The movie.
Seriously! The movie is an hour-long documentary that provides inspiring and irrefutable evidence of play's vital importance in every part of our lives. It shares powerful stories of play healing trauma, reducing crime, resolving conflicts, finding ingenious solutions to seemingly intractable problems, and making life worth living (to name just a few). 
BECOME A PLAY ANGEL! I'll cut to the chase. We really can't make this film without your help. No kidding. (Cue violin music) So far this project has been carried by passion, awesome volunteers, a sense of humor, and more of my own personal funds than anybody would advise. We need at least another $25,000 to finish a 20 mn. pilot, secure our PBS distribution contract, and attract sponsors. The more we raise the longer and better the pilot will be (see Where Your Money Will Go below for details). Your participation truly makes the difference!
If you need your donation to be tax-deductible, let us know (but you should know that it takes another 6% off what we receive).
WANT TO SEE MORE? Watch the full 4 min. trailer by clicking on the irresistible boxer below (but don't forget to come back and contribute). 
To see what some delightful play experts have to say about us watch this!
WHY A MOVIE ABOUT PLAY?
”The opposite of play is not work, it’s depression.” Brian Sutton-Smith, Harvard University
...and the statistics on depression are astonishing! Over 18 million people in the U.S. alone are suffering from it and in 2007, suicide was the third leading cause of death in young people. And this is just the tip of the iceberg of the proven emotional, physical, social and spiritual costs of play-deprivation. In the meantime, schools are eliminating recesses while adults are working longer hours with shorter vacations in more stultifying jobs than ever before.
Let's face it, most of us are exhausted and over-worked. And our children are in serious trouble. To change our lifestyles we need to KNOW that play is not a luxury, that our basic health and well-being depend on it. Seriously! The movie will make the importance of play irrefutable and help unleash the immense resources we need in order to meet the challenges of our time.
LET'S PLAY! 
Thank you so much for contributing what you can. If you can't afford to give financially right now, but want to play and find out if Garbanzo and I get out of the box, you can sign up HERE . You'll get my video blog updates from inside the page. 
Whether you support the project financially or not, you can help by spreading the word. Send an email to your friends, pin a post about it on your Facebook page, comment about it on other FB pages, share it with group lists, tweet about it, retweet our tweets, retweet other supporters' retweets, or heck, just sing it from the top of a mountain. JUST SHARE IT ANY WAY YOU CAN! We would be positively delighted!
PLUS...you can play with us and help spread the word about the campaign on Dance Where You Are Day. On September 18th. Find out more HERE!
WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO
At the end of 2011 I posted a 9 min. teaser on Vimeo, which got 34,000 plays in 154 countries in three weeks. Since then the project has received three grants and generous private donations that have enabled us to film about 1/3 of the interviews. 
With $25,000 we will be able to cover the following topics:
The evolution of play in animals and humans
Early childhood development and the crisis created by current trends
The possibilities and benefits of play through old age
If we raise $50,000 we will be able to create a 30 min. piece that includes these topics: 
The great video game debate
How play heals trauma
How play transforms communities and public spaces
And with $75,000 will be able to produce a piece that includes these topics:
The signs of an emerging play movement
Creativity, innovation, and discovery
How all of life can be play
And with $100,000 we can finish the 1 hour production that includes:
Animations
Graphics
Original Soundtrack
And with more than $100,000 we can include stories from around the world.
To read more about the stories we're planning to cover go HERE
WHAT YOU GET (OH BOY!)
Of course, more than anything else, you get that special feeling of being part of something both meaningful and FUN! In addition, there's a whole bunch of great stuff on that list to the right. 
We're providing these Official Play Permits, which grant permission to be goofy & outrageous in the name of a more playful world. And if someone stops you...hey, just show them your pass.
 WHY YOU CAN TRUST ME
"I've known Gwen for 17 years both personally and professionally and she has not only finished every project she's started but done so with a unique flair and genius. I'd vouch for her in a heartbeat" - Andy Abrahams Wilson, Executive Director, OPEN EYE PICTURES
"Gwen pulled off a big project for us (The Story of Stuff Course) with a small budget, a lot of moving parts, and a punishing deadline. I completely trust her to over-deliver on any commitment she makes." Annie Leonard, The Story of Stuff Project
Basically, I have never missed a deadline or failed to complete a project (if you're reading between the lines you've probably already guessed that I'm a workaholic teaching what I most need to learn). You can find out about the projects I've worked on HERE! 
CONTACT ME 
I’d love to be in touch so don’t hesitate to let me know if you have any questions.  Tel +1 415 785 7185 info@seriouslythemovie.com 

www.seriouslythemovie.com

If you’re trying to donate and having any trouble at all paying, just send me an email and someone on the team will help you out. And heck, you can always just send us a check. We’ll make sure you get the reward however you end up paying. Send to: SERIOUSLY! The movie, P.O. Box 1172, Woodacre, CA 94973
I'm delighted by your awesomeness, your open-heartedness and generosity!
LET THERE BE PLAY! Seriously!
Gwen
